title: CNN anchor fires back at Trump campaign official: You're lying
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar talks to Trump campaign communications director Tim Murtaugh about coronavirus testing.

title: China's latest starfish-shaped airport set to boost tourism in northeast
description: Qingdao, a Chinese coastal city famous for being the headquarters of Tsingtao Brewery, is poised for a major tourism boost with the completion of the new Qingdao Jiaodong International Airport.

title: 80 years later, China won't forget what these American pilots did
description: Consider this job offer:

title: Adorable photos released as Prince George turns 7
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge released two photos of Prince George to mark his seventh birthday on Wednesday.

title: Scientists accidentally create new hybrid fish
description: Researchers in Hungary were trying to save the Russian sturgeon from extinction. Instead, they accidentally created the hybrid "sturddlefish."

title: CNN's Alisyn Camerota on lawsuit: I guess Fox News is rotten to the core
description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota reacts to a lawsuit filed in federal court against Fox News which accused former host Ed Henry of rape and alleged that he retaliated against two women who rejected his advances.

title: Video shows Trump in public just hours after mask tweet
description: President Trump tweeted a rare photo of himself in a face mask after struggling in the polls, but just hours later he was seen in public without one.

title: Rare yellow turtle discovered
description: A farmer in eastern India has found a yellow turtle which experts say is the product of albinism.

title: Biden says he's considering four Black women to be his running mate
A massive asteroid shower hit Earth and the moon 800 million years ago, study says
description: Over the course of Earth's ancient history, our planet has been blitzed with a variety of foreign objects, some of which may have triggered major events shaping this place we now call home.

title: Do you sleep with your eyes open? (You'll be surprised how many of us do)
David Schwimmer says 'Friends' reunion is happening soon
description: David Schwimmer talked about the impending "Friends" reunion special on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon."

title: Trump blasts Beijing in public, but privately Trump org imports tons of Chinese goods
description: President Donald Trump has cast himself as tough on China and promised that his trade negotiations with Beijing would economically benefit everyday Americans, even as Trump-owned properties have continued to contribute to the trade deficit with the country he rails about.

title: Watch vets rescue seagull caught in disposable mask
description: These UK veterinarians helped free a seagull caught in a disposable mask.

title: UK took its 'eye off the ball' on Russian meddling, long-awaited report finds
description: The UK took its "eye off the ball" in relation to Russia's attempts to influence British politics and allowed illicit finance to swirl around London unchecked, a long-awaited report says.

title: Skydiving and wingsuiting down a 4,500-foot mountain
description: Jumping out of helicopters, flying under bridges and landing onto fast-moving cars is what Norwegian Bjorn Magne Bryn plans to do for the rest of his life.

title: Eagerly awaiting the 'Friends' reunion? David Schwimmer has some good news
description: It might be hard to see some of your actual friends this year, but David Schwimmer has some news that might cheer you up: the "Friends" reunion could start filming next month.

title: EU leaders strike 'historic' $2 trillion deal to rebuild Europe's economy
description: After almost five days of fraught discussions, European Union leaders have agreed on a 750 billion euro (almost $858 billion) stimulus plan to help fund Europe's recovery from the coronavirus crisis.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores twice to set another scoring record as Juventus moves closer to Serie A title
description: Cristiano Ronaldo passed the 50-goal landmark in Serie A as his second-half brace saw Juventus defeat Lazio 2-1 and move eight points clear at the top of table.

title: Suspect in fatal shooting at US judge's home described himself as 'anti-feminist'
description: On his website, Roy Den Hollander described himself as an "anti-feminist" lawyer who defended "men's rights." His personal writings and life's work reveal a toxic stew of sexist and racist bigotry.

title: Tens of thousands displaced in Assam as floods heap misery on pandemic stricken region
description: Unrelenting monsoon rains have triggered severe flooding in the Indian state of Assam, killing at least 85 people, displacing tens of thousands residents and drowning rare wildlife in a national park.

title: Oxford's vaccine triggers immune response, trial shows
description: Results from trials involving three different coronavirus vaccines released Monday, all showing positive results, with evidence the vaccines can produce immune responses that would be expected to protect people against infection.

title: US sanctions 11 Chinese companies
description: The United States is restricting 11 Chinese companies from buying American technology and other goods because it says they're linked to alleged human rights violations in Xinjiang.

title: The Tower of London's Beefeaters are facing redundancy for the first time in 500 years
description: Beefeaters, the Yeoman Warders who live and work at the Tower of London, are facing job losses for the first time in their 500-year history.

title: Barcelona's latest virus outbreak is a warning to other cities
description: In Barcelona and surrounding areas in Spain's Catalonia region, some 3 million residents are being urged to stay home to curb a major coronavirus outbreak. Almost 3,000 new infections were found over the weekend. CNN's Atika Shubert reports.

title: 'Things could get very ugly': Experts fear crisis after the election
Report finds child athletes are abused in Japan
description: Hitting children with bats and sticks, slapping them across the face, and holding their heads underwater to simulate drowning are some of the abusive coaching techniques allegedly used in Japan as revealed in a report by Human Rights Watch (HRW).

title: Alyssa Nakken made MLB history as the first woman to coach on the field during a major league game
description: A woman made Major League Baseball history Monday by coaching first base for the San Francisco Giants during an exhibition game Monday.

title: Luxury homes in Australia are falling into the ocean due to coastal erosion
description: In a coastal neighborhood in Australia's New South Wales state, luxury beachfront homes are in danger of collapsing into the ocean.

title: Surge in US cases has left labs overwhelmed
description: More Americans are testing positive for coronavirus all over the US at record-breaking numbers and the surge is slowing down testing.

title: Covid-19 survivors grapple with lingering effects
description: From breathlessness to fatigue to memory loss, many Covid-19 survivors have reported lingering symptoms. Researchers in Italy and the UK are working against the clock to answer the many questions on the virus' long-term effects. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: San Francisco Giants' players kneel during national anthem in exhibition game against Oakland
description: Multiple San Francisco Giants players and the team's manager knelt during the national anthem in Monday's game against the Oakland Athletics.

title: Detroit police officer charged for allegedly shooting 3 photojournalists with rubber pellets
description: A Detroit police officer was charged with three counts of felonious assault on Monday in connection with the shooting of three photojournalists with rubber pellets during a protest in May.

title: US works to bolster Ukraine's Navy to confront Russian threat
description: The US is working to bolster Ukraine's navy, a force that was decimated by Russia's seizure of Crimea in 2014, an effort that comes as Moscow strengthens its own forces in the region in a buildup that some officials see as a threat to NATO's southeastern flank.

title: Racial discrimination may harm Black people's cognitive health, study finds
description: Chronic stress can change your brain. Experiencing racism could make it worse.

title: Republican leaders vow to fill a potential Supreme Court vacancy
description: Senate Republican leaders, undeterred by the scathing criticism leveled against them for blocking President Barack Obama's election-year Supreme Court nominee in 2016, are signaling that they are prepared to confirm a nominee by President Donald Trump even if that vacancy occurred after this year's election.

title: CNN anchor fact-checks Trump's Fox interview: Give us a break
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar fact-checks claims about the coronavirus pandemic made by President Trump during an interview with Fox News' Chris Wallace.

title: Alvin Ailey dance theater official fired after sexual misconduct allegations
description: The Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, one of the most prominent dance companies in the US and an iconic institution in the world of Black performing arts, on Monday fired a senior artistic director amid allegations of sexual harassment.

title: The story behind the world's largest airplane
description: The first powered plane flight, performed by the Wright Brothers over the windswept beach of North Carolina's Kitty Hawk in 1903, covered 120 feet. That historic flight would fit entirely in the cargo hold of the Antonov AN-225 Mriya, the world's biggest fully operational plane.

title: Couple who brandished guns at US protesters face charges
description: The Missouri couple seen in a viral video brandishing guns at protesters outside their mansion have been charged, the St. Louis circuit attorney said.

title: Why Trump flipped on wearing face masks
description: CNN's Dana Bash reports President Donald Trump tweeted a photo of himself wearing a face mask because of his poor poll numbers.

title: 'Things could get very ugly': Experts fear crisis after the election
description:
• Analysis: Why Trump can't make the election about Biden
• Trump tweets image of himself in mask and calls it 'patriotic'
• Analysis: What Trump's sudden rediscovery of the pandemic reveals

title: Indigenous Australians had their languages taken from them, and it's still causing issues today
description: "I'm Fanny Smith. I was born on Flinders Island. I'm the last of the Tasmanians."
